title: The Sociology of Science and Technology
yc_attrs: This course can be applied towards the Social Sciences Yale College distributional requirement.
description:
What do scientists actually do? How do they really think? Does science really make progress due to the rigorous use of methods? The course moves beyond idealized images, mission statements, and stereotypes of science to explore what social scientists have discovered when they investigate the real world of science and technology. The course explores both how social factors influence, impact, inspire, constrain, and intrude upon science (for better and/or worse); and how science influences, shapes, and impacts, society, and culture (for better and/or worse). Topics include the role of scientific communities in shaping knowledge, critiques of science, the role of gender, the concept of “western” science, and the politics and political implications of science and technology.

Course Requirements:

Regular attendance and class participation - 10%

Discussion Leadership – 10%

Critical Reflections – 15%

Short Paper – 25%

Research paper – 40%

There is no cap on the number of students who can take this course. All students who want to take the course are welcomed.
